lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He appeared to bring it off without major stumbles, abetted by a press corps that seemed at pains to maintain a civil manner until the very end when it crowded round him trying to get in one last question as he was leaving the rostrum in the White House East Room.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: As expected, the president repeatedly stated -- now calmly, now with some fire -- that he knew nothing about that scheme, said to have been run by White House National Security aide Oliver North, since fired, with the knowledge of presidential adviser John Poindexter, now resigned.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Just as important from Reagan's standpoint, however, was the manner in which he handled his first non-scripted public accounting of the scandal since the details first began leaking out last November and plunged his administration into deep political crisis.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He appeared to bring it off without major stumbles, abetted by a press corps that seemed at pains to maintain a civil manner until the very end when it crowded round him trying to get in one last question as he was leaving the rostrum in the White House East Room.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Just as important from Reagan's standpoint, however, was the manner in which he handled his first non-scripted public accounting of the scandal since the details first began leaking out last November and plunged his administration into deep political crisis.
